intro: Uragoga dyeriana, commonly known as the Dyer's uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when ripe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
